intro: Senecio uspantanensis, commonly known as the Uspantanensis groundsels, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
